I.i.1.A.4.i
.
Definition:  Initial Claim
An
initial claim
is a substantially complete claim for a benefit, other than a supplemental claim, on an application form prescribed by the Secretary, including:
the first filing by a claimant (original claim), and
a subsequent claim filed by a claimant for
an increase in a disability evaluation
a new benefit, or
a new disability.
References
:  For more information on
substantially complete claims, see
38 CFR 3.159(a)(3)
, and
M21-1 Part I, Subpart i, 1.A.4.f
initial claims, see
38 CFR 3.1(p)(1)
, and
claims for increase, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 2.C
.
title: M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, Chapter 1, Section A - Description and General Information on Duty to Notify and Duty to Assist
citation: Part I, Subpart i, Chapter 1, Section A
